# Important Phrases
# Population 
> a complete set of individual units of our interest.
# Sample 
> data points randomly chosen from the corresponding population. 
# Parameter
> is a quantity about an entire population. It is often unknown, therefor samples are taken to further comprehend the parameter of the variale/s being measured. 
# Statistic
> is a quantity about a selected sample. A calculated statistic is the best estimate of the unknown parameter.
# Confidence Intervals
> a plausable range of values for the population parameter
